info.title: Forward Email API
info.description:
Welcome to the comprehensive API documentation for Forward Email. This API allows you to manage email forwarding, domains, aliases, outbound emails, and more programmatically.

## Key Features
*   **Domain Management:** Create, retrieve, update, delete, and verify domains.
*   **Alias Management:** Manage email aliases, including creation, updates, and recipient management.
*   **Outbound SMTP:** Send emails via SMTP, manage limits, and track sent emails.
*   **Account & Logs:** Manage your account details and download activity logs.
*   **Security:** Encrypt TXT records and manage domain members/invites.
*   **Coming Soon:** Features like CardDAV contacts, CalDAV calendars, and IMAP/POP3 message/folder management are planned.

## Authentication
Most endpoints require authentication using your **API Key**. Provide the API Key as the `username` in the Basic Authentication header, leaving the password empty.

```http
Authorization: Basic QVBJX1RPS0VOOg==
```
(Replace `API_TOKEN` with your actual key before Base64 encoding)

Endpoints related to **Alias Contacts, Calendars, Messages, and Folders** (currently marked as "Coming Soon") will use a generated alias username and password for Basic Authentication.

## Errors
The API uses standard HTTP status codes to indicate success or failure. Error responses include a JSON body with a `message` field detailing the error.

| Status Code | Meaning             |
|-------------|---------------------|
| 200         | OK                  |
| 400         | Bad Request         |
| 401         | Unauthorized        |
| 403         | Forbidden           |
| 404         | Not Found           |
| 429         | Too Many Requests   |
| 500         | Internal Server Error|
| 501         | Not Implemented     |
| 502         | Bad Gateway         |
| 503         | Service Unavailable |
| 504         | Gateway Time-out    |

*If you encounter a `5xx` error, please contact [api@forwardemail.net](mailto:api@forwardemail.net).*

## Localization
API responses are translated based on the user's detected locale or the `Accept-Language` header. Over 25 languages are supported.

## Pagination
Endpoints returning lists support pagination via query parameters.

| Parameter    | Type    | Optional | Description                                                                 | Default | Constraints        |
|--------------|---------|----------|-----------------------------------------------------------------------------|---------|--------------------|
| `page`       | Integer | Yes      | Page number to retrieve.                                                    | 1       | `>= 1`             |
| `limit`      | Integer | Yes      | Number of results per page.                                                 | 10      | `>= 1`, `<= 50`    |
| `pagination` | Boolean | Yes      | Opt-in to pagination behavior (required before Nov 1st, 2024 for some endpoints). | false   |                    |

**Pagination Headers:**
*   `X-Page-Count`: Total page count.
*   `X-Page-Current`: Current page number.
*   `X-Page-Size`: Number of items on the current page.
*   `X-Item-Count`: Total number of items across all pages.
*   `Link`: Navigation links (prev, next, first, last).

**Example:**
```bash
curl "https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains?page=2&limit=20&pagination=true" \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

## Recommended Libraries
*   **Ruby:** [Faraday](https://github.com/lostisland/faraday)
*   **Python:** [requests](https://requests.readthedocs.io/en/latest/)
*   **Java:** [OkHttp](https://square.github.io/okhttp/)
*   **PHP:** [Guzzle](https://docs.guzzlephp.org/en/stable/)
*   **JavaScript/Node.js:** [superagent](https://github.com/visionmedia/superagent) (Maintained by Forward Email)
*   **Go:** `net/http`
*   **.NET:** [RestSharp](https://restsharp.dev/)

ApiKeyAuth.description:
Use your API Key as the **username** for Basic Authentication. Leave the password field empty.

**Example:**
If your API Key is `YOUR_API_KEY`, the Base64 encoded value for the `Authorization` header would be `echo -n "YOUR_API_KEY:" | base64`.

```http
Authorization: Basic WU9VUl9BUElfS0VZOg==
```

AliasAuth.description:
Use the generated **alias username and password** for Basic Authentication. This applies to endpoints under:
*   Alias Contacts (CardDAV)
*   Alias Calendars (CalDAV)
*   Alias Messages (IMAP/POP3)
*   Alias Folders (IMAP/POP3)

*(Note: These features are currently marked as "Coming Soon")*

**Example:**
If the alias username is `alias@domain.com` and password is `GENERATED_PASSWORD`, the Base64 encoded value would be `echo -n "alias@domain.com:GENERATED_PASSWORD" | base64`.

```http
Authorization: Basic YWxpYXNAZG9tYWluLmNvbTpHRU5FUkFURURfUEFTU1dPUkQ=
```

from.description: The email address of the sender (must exist as an alias of the domain)

oneOf.description: Comma separated list of recipients for the "To" header
Array of recipients for the "To" header
Comma separated list of recipients for the "Cc" header
Array of recipients for the "Cc" header
Comma separated list of recipients for the "Bcc" header
Array of recipients for the "Bcc" header

text.description: The plaintext version of the message

html.description: The HTML version of the message

sender.description: The email address for the "Sender" header

raw.description: With the exception of envelope and dkim (set automatically), all Nodemailer options are supported

page.name: page
page.description: Page of results to return. If not specified, value will be 1. Must be a number greater than or equal to 1.

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Number of results to return per page. Defaults to 10 if not specified. Must be a number greater than or equal to 1, and less than or equal to 50.

get.description:
**Download logs**

Description: Our API programmatically allows you to download logs for your account. Submitting a request to this endpoint will process all logs for your account and email them to you as an attachment (Gzip compressed CSV spreadsheet file) once complete.

This allows you to create background jobs with a Cron job or using Node.js job scheduling software Bree to receive logs whenever you desire. Note that this endpoint is limited to `10` requests per day.

The attachment is the lowercase form of `email-deliverability-logs-YYYY-MM-DD-h-mm-A-z.csv.gz` and the email itself contains a brief summary of the logs retrieved.

Querystring Parameters:
- `domain` (String FQDN, Optional): Filter logs by fully qualified domain.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: Filter logs by fully qualified domain ("FQDN"). If not provided, all logs across all domains will be retrieved.

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Search for logs by email, domain, alias name, IP address, or date (M/Y, M/D/YY, M-D, M-D-YY, or M.D.YY format).

parameters.name: bounce_category
parameters.description: Search for logs by a specific bounce category (e.g. "blocklist").

parameters.name: response_code
parameters.description: Search for logs by a specific error response code (e.g. 421 or 550).

200.description: Logs will be emailed as an attachment

message.example: Logs will be emailed to you shortly

429.description: Rate limit exceeded (10 requests for 'download logs')

get.description:
**List outbound SMTP emails**

Description: List all outbound SMTP emails.

Pagination: Supports standard pagination parameters.

Example Request:
```
curl https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/emails \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

post.description:
**Create outbound SMTP email**

Description: Create and send an outbound SMTP email.

Body Parameters:
- Various parameters based on Nodemailer's message configuration

Example Request:
```
curl -X POST https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/emails \
  -u API_TOKEN: \
  -d "from=alias@domain.com" \
  -d "to=user@gmail.com" \
  -d "subject=Hello" \
  -d "text=Hello world"
```

get.description:
**Get outbound SMTP email limit**

Description: This is a simple endpoint that returns a JSON object containing the `count` and `limit` for the number of daily SMTP outbound messages on a per account basis.

Example Request:
```
curl https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/emails/limit \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

**Retrieve outbound SMTP email**

Description: Retrieve a specific outbound SMTP email.

Example Request:
```
curl https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/emails/EMAIL_ID \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

delete.description:
**Delete outbound SMTP email**

Description: Delete a specific outbound SMTP email.

Example Request:
```
curl -X DELETE https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/emails/EMAIL_ID \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

get.description:
**List domains**

Description: List all domains.

Pagination: Supports standard pagination parameters.

Example Request:
```
curl https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

post.description:
**Create domain**

Description: Create a new domain.

Body Parameters:
- `name` (String, Required): Domain name

Example Request:
```
curl -X POST https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains \
  -u API_TOKEN: \
  -d "name=domain.com"
```

429.description: Rate limit exceeded (50 requests for 'create domain')

get.description:
**Retrieve domain**

Description: Retrieve a specific domain.

Example Request:
```
curl https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

put.description:
**Update domain**

Description: Update a specific domain.

Example Request:
```
curl -X PUT https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

delete.description:
**Delete domain**

Description: Delete a specific domain.

Example Request:
```
curl -X DELETE https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

get.description:
**Verify domain records**

Description: Verify DNS records for a specific domain.

Example Request:
```
curl https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID/verify-records \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

verified.description: Whether the domain records are verified

get.description:
**Accept domain invite**

Description: Accept an invitation to a domain.

Example Request:
```
curl https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID/invites \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

post.description:
**Create domain invite**

Description: Create an invitation to a domain.

Body Parameters:
- `email` (String, Required): Email address to invite

Example Request:
```
curl -X POST https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID/invites \
  -u API_TOKEN: \
  -d "email=user@gmail.com"
```

429.description: Rate limit exceeded (10 requests for 'create invite')

delete.description:
**Remove domain invite**

Description: Remove an invitation to a domain.

Body Parameters:
- `email` (String, Required): Email address to remove invitation for

Example Request:
```
curl -X DELETE https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID/invites \
  -u API_TOKEN: \
  -d "email=user@gmail.com"
```

email.description: Email address to remove invitation for

put.description:
**Update domain member**

Description: Update a domain member.

Example Request:
```
curl -X PUT https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID/members/MEMBER_ID \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

delete.description:
**Remove domain member**

Description: Remove a domain member.

Example Request:
```
curl -X DELETE https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID/members/MEMBER_ID \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

get.description:
**List domain aliases**

Description: List all aliases for a specific domain.

Pagination: Supports standard pagination parameters.

Example Request:
```
curl https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID/aliases \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

post.description:
**Create new domain alias**

Description: Create a new alias for a specific domain.

Body Parameters:
- `name` (String, Required): Alias name
- `recipients` (Array, Required): Array of recipient email addresses

Example Request:
```
curl -X POST https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID/aliases \
  -u API_TOKEN: \
  -d "name=alias" \
  -d "recipients[]=user@gmail.com"
```

429.description: Rate limit exceeded (300 requests for 'create alias')

get.description:
**Retrieve domain alias**

Description: Retrieve a specific alias for a domain.

Example Request:
```
curl https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID/aliases/ALIAS_ID \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

put.description:
**Update domain alias**

Description: Update a specific alias for a domain.

Example Request:
```
curl -X PUT https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID/aliases/ALIAS_ID \
  -u API_TOKEN: \
  -d "recipients[]=user@gmail.com"
```

delete.description:
**Delete domain alias**

Description: Delete a specific alias for a domain.

Example Request:
```
curl -X DELETE https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/domains/DOMAIN_ID/aliases/ALIAS_ID \
  -u API_TOKEN:
```

post.description:
**Encrypt TXT Record**

Description: Encrypt a TXT record.

Body Parameters:
- `text` (String, Required): Text to encrypt

Example Request:
```
curl -X POST https://api.forwardemail.net/v1/encrypt \
  -u API_TOKEN: \
  -d "text=user@gmail.com"
```
